{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Accountant",
  "description": "Mshel Homes Limited is a real estate development and marketing company incorporated in 2018 with a unique vision to be the leading real estate company in Nigeria, with an outstanding reputation for honesty, integrity and impeccable customer service.

At Mshel Homes Limited our mission is to create a lifetime relationship with our clientele by deliverying property solutions through innovative and technological driven processes that caters to your real estate needs whilst adhering to the highest standards, systems and performance goals necessary to achieving your dreams.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Overview


	The Accountant will be responsible for managing the financial records, ensuring compliance with accounting standards, and supporting the financial operations of the real estate construction business.
	This role requires strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and proficiency in financial management systems to ensure accurate reporting and effective cost control.


Key Responsibilities
Financial Record Keeping:


	Maintain accurate books of accounts, ledgers, and journals.
	Record daily financial transactions including sales, purchases, payroll, and expenses.
	Ensure timely posting of entries in compliance with accounting standards.


Budgeting &amp; Cost Control:


	Prepare and monitor project budgets for construction activities.
	Track construction costs, material purchases, and subcontractor payments.
	Identify variances between actual and budgeted expenditures and recommend corrective actions.


Accounts Payable &amp; Receivable:


	Process vendor invoices, payments, and reconcile supplier accounts.
	Manage receivables from clients, tenants, and property buyers.
	Ensure timely collection of outstanding payments.


Financial Reporting:


	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements.
	Generate project-specific financial reports for management review.
	Support external audits and provide necessary documentation.


Taxation &amp; Compliance:


	Ensure compliance with local tax laws and regulations.
	Prepare and file VAT, PAYE, and corporate tax returns.
	Liaise with regulatory authorities and auditors when required.


Payroll Administration:


	Process staff salaries, allowances, and deductions.
	Maintain accurate employee payroll records.
	Ensure compliance with statutory contributions (e.g., pension, health insurance).


Cash Flow Management:


	Monitor cash inflows and outflows to maintain liquidity.
	Prepare cash flow forecasts for ongoing and upcoming projects.
	Advise management on financial planning and investment decisions.


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	3&ndash;5 years of experience in accounting, preferably in real estate or construction.
	Professional certification (ACA, ACCA, CPA) preferred.
	Strong knowledge of IFRS and local accounting standards.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and accounting software (e.g., Sage, QuickBooks, SAP).
	Excellent analytical, problem?solving, and organizational skills.
	Strong communication and interpersonal abilities.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.


Competencies:


	Attention to detail and accuracy.
	Integrity and confidentiality in handling financial data.
	Ability to collaborate with project managers, engineers, and external stakeholders.
	Strong business acumen with an understanding of real estate and construction industry dynamics.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV to:&nbsp;Recruitment@mshelconstruction.com&nbsp;using the Job Position&nbsp;&nbsp;as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2026-02-04",
  "validThrough": "2026-03-05",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Mshel Homes Limited"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",

    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 150000,
      "maxValue": 250000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Accountant Job at Mshel Homes Limited




        
    

        
        Mshel Homes Limited is a real estate development and marketing company incorporated in 2018 with a unique vision to be the leading real estate company in Nigeria, with an outstanding reputation for honesty, integrity and impeccable customer service.

At Mshel Homes Limited our mission is to create a lifetime relationship with our clientele by deliverying property solutions through innovative and technological driven processes that caters to your real estate needs whilst adhering to the highest standards, systems and performance goals necessary to achieving your dreams.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Position Overview


	The Accountant will be responsible for managing the financial records, ensuring compliance with accounting standards, and supporting the financial operations of the real estate construction business.
	This role requires strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and proficiency in financial management systems to ensure accurate reporting and effective cost control.


Key Responsibilities
Financial Record Keeping:


	Maintain accurate books of accounts, ledgers, and journals.
	Record daily financial transactions including sales, purchases, payroll, and expenses.
	Ensure timely posting of entries in compliance with accounting standards.


Budgeting & Cost Control:


	Prepare and monitor project budgets for construction activities.
	Track construction costs, material purchases, and subcontractor payments.
	Identify variances between actual and budgeted expenditures and recommend corrective actions.


Accounts Payable & Receivable:


	Process vendor invoices, payments, and reconcile supplier accounts.
	Manage receivables from clients, tenants, and property buyers.
	Ensure timely collection of outstanding payments.


Financial Reporting:


	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements.
	Generate project-specific financial reports for management review.
	Support external audits and provide necessary documentation.


Taxation & Compliance:


	Ensure compliance with local tax laws and regulations.
	Prepare and file VAT, PAYE, and corporate tax returns.
	Liaise with regulatory authorities and auditors when required.


Payroll Administration:


	Process staff salaries, allowances, and deductions.
	Maintain accurate employee payroll records.
	Ensure compliance with statutory contributions (e.g., pension, health insurance).


Cash Flow Management:


	Monitor cash inflows and outflows to maintain liquidity.
	Prepare cash flow forecasts for ongoing and upcoming projects.
	Advise management on financial planning and investment decisions.


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	3–5 years of experience in accounting, preferably in real estate or construction.
	Professional certification (ACA, ACCA, CPA) preferred.
	Strong knowledge of IFRS and local accounting standards.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and accounting software (e.g., Sage, QuickBooks, SAP).
	Excellent analytical, problem?solving, and organizational skills.
	Strong communication and interpersonal abilities.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.


Competencies:


	Attention to detail and accuracy.
	Integrity and confidentiality in handling financial data.
	Ability to collaborate with project managers, engineers, and external stakeholders.
	Strong business acumen with an understanding of real estate and construction industry dynamics.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV to: Recruitment@mshelconstruction.com using the Job Position  as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Mobile Developer Job at Conclase Consulting




        
    

        
        At Conclase Consulting, we provide top notch IT solutions and support services to help you transform your business into an Intelligent Enterprise, redefine the customer experience, deliver a step change in productivity, and inspire total workforce engagement to achieve game-changing outcomes.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Mobile Developer
Job Location: Ikeja & Lekki - Lagos
Work Model: Onsite 

Requirements
     

            
    




	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 5+ years of experience; Banking or Fintech Experience is a must.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: careers@conclaseint.com or o.akindiya@conclaseint.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "At Conclase Consulting, we provide top notch IT solutions and support services to help you transform your business into an Intelligent Enterprise, redefine the customer experience, deliver a step change in productivity, and inspire total workforce engagement to achieve game-changing outcomes.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Al/ML Engineer Job at Conclase Consulting




        
    

        
        At Conclase Consulting, we provide top notch IT solutions and support services to help you transform your business into an Intelligent Enterprise, redefine the customer experience, deliver a step change in productivity, and inspire total workforce engagement to achieve game-changing outcomes.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Al/ML Engineer
Job Location: Ikeja & Lekki - Lagos
Work Model: Onsite 

Requirements
     

            
    




	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 5+ years of experience; Banking or Fintech Experience is a must.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: careers@conclaseint.com or o.akindiya@conclaseint.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

HR Officer / Manager Job at the NSIA-LUTH Cancer Center (NLCC)




        
    

        
        NSIA-LUTH Cancer Centre (NLCC) is a specialist cancer treatment facility located in Lagos State, Nigeria. At NLCC, we offer modern innovative therapies and have the largest, most experienced and skilled oncology workforce in Nigeria. Our team of medical experts, including Clinical and Radiation Oncologists, Medical Physicists, Radiotherapists, and Oncology nurses, are trained to offer comprehensive and compassionate care at every stage of the patient’s journey. We provide patients with a multidisciplinary team approach for the management of all types of cancers with state-of-the-art equipment for cancer treatments to post-treatment consultation and supportive therapies.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: HR Officer / Manager

Job Locations: Akwa Ibom, Bauchi, Delta, Enugu, Kwara, Oyo, Plateau and Yobe
Job type: Full-time

Requirements


	Candidates should possess a BSc. in Human Resource Management, Business Administration or a related field
	Relevant experience in the applied role or a related professional/healthcare environment
	Required academic and professional qualification, certifications, and licenses applicable to the role
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills
	Professionalism, teamwork, and attention to detail
	Demonstrated Commitment to quality service delivery and organizational values
    

    

        Click here to Apply
